docs.title: Welcome to FreeSTAR Everywhere Wiki
docs.text:
This is the central documentation hub for the FreeSTAR Everywhere project.

Explore the pages above to get started!

docs.title: About FreeSTAR Everywhere
docs.text: FreeSTAR Everywhere is a Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) service, designed exclusively for licensed amateur radio operators. It allows these operators to connect to the global amateur radio network using a standard telephone or any SIP-compatible device (like a smartphone app or VoIP phone).

docs.title: Mission
docs.text: The mission of FreeSTAR Everywhere is to provide licensed amateur radio operators with seamless and accessible connectivity to the global FreeSTAR Network, utilizing common communication methods like telephone and VoIP services to bridge the gap between traditional and internet-based ham radio communication.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Welcome to FreeSTAR Everywhere! This guide helps you set up and begin using the platform.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
1. Clone the repository: git clone https://github.com/FreeSTAR-Network/freestar-everywhere-wiki.git
  2. Install dependencies: pip install -r requirements.txt
  3. Serve locally: mkdocs serve
  4. View your wiki at localhost:8000
